intro: Popowia mangenotii, commonly known as the mangenot's popowia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
